Sub: Modifications in the security scheme of Airports: Rea:

Of late, several incidents have come to light wherein CASOs at the unit
level have affected certain modifications in the pattern of deployment without due
consideration of their repercussion or the approval of this HOrs in contravention
of the overall security scheme, as approved by the BCAS (Sometimes this has
been done in pursuance to discussion in the airport level meetings). Such
changes should not be made even if there is the approval of RDCOS(CA) as
basic security schome can’t be changed by him as well. Complications which
arise due to such undue modifications, including security lapses, sometimes
cause avoidable embarrassment to this office and the CISF in general.

02. In view of above, it is hereby directed that henceforth, any modification in
deployment pattern, which results in change of duties or responsibilities of CISF

or is a departure from the basic security scheme, as laid, down by the BCAS,

0 801

03. In case circumstances so demand, such proposed modifications (even if
temporary in nature) should be brought to the notice of this HQrs with justification
for consideration and affected only after approval.

Strict compliance by all concerned, particularly all CASOs, is expected.
